posts.post_content:
For people who don't get what "sacrifice Eldrazi Spawn" means, "Eldrazi Spawn" is a creature type. More precisely, Eldrazi and Spawn are creature types, and an "Eldrazi Spawn" is a permanent that has the creature types Eldrazi and Spawn.  
  
Changelings are all creature types, including "Eldrazi" and "Spawn." You can sac Changelings for his alternate cost. You can use [Amoeboid Changeling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amoeboid Changeling) to turn other creatures into Eldrazi Spawn. They wouldn't be able to give you mana, though, but they would still have the types Eldrazi and Spawn.  
  
"Eldrazi Spawn" in this creature's text refers to permanents with the creature types Eldrazi and Spawn, not to permanents named "Eldrazi Spawn." If it needed those it would specify "creatures named Eldrazi Spawn." Also notice that it doesn't specifically need "Eldrazi Spawn creatures" so if there were tribal Changeling enchantments you could sac those for this guy.  
  
You could not, however, produce Eldrazi Spawn tokens with something like ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
For people who don't get what "sacrifice Eldrazi Spawn" means, "Eldrazi Spawn" is a creature type. More precisely, Eldrazi and Spawn are creature types, and an "Eldrazi Spawn" is a permanent that has the creature types Eldrazi and Spawn.

Changelings are all creature types, including "Eldrazi" and "Spawn." You can sac Changelings for his alternate cost. You can use Amoeboid Changeling to turn other creatures into Eldrazi Spawn. They wouldn't be able to give you mana, though, but they would still have the types Eldrazi and Spawn.

"Eldrazi Spawn" in this creature's text refers to permanents with the creature types Eldrazi and Spawn, not to permanents named "Eldrazi Spawn." If it needed those it would specify "creatures named Eldrazi Spawn." Also notice that it doesn't specifically need "Eldrazi Spawn creatures" so if there were tribal Changeling enchantments you could sac those for this guy.

You could not, however, produce Eldrazi Spawn tokens with something like ... (see all)

Posted By: Vaernnond (6/17/2010 8:42:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: An excellent card and by far my favorite of the nonrare Eldrazi. It can get onto the field blindingly fast provided you have Eldrazi spawn token ramp, and can start wrecking face as early as turn three. However, it's dead weight if you don't have any spawn tokens, because hardcasting it for 9 is far less efficient than its brother [Ulamog's Crusher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog's Crusher). Still, the alternate casting cost and the hefty body that still satisfies [Not of This World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Not of This World)'s alternate casting cost makes this a great card for an Eldrazi deck.
posts.html:
An excellent card and by far my favorite of the nonrare Eldrazi. It can get onto the field blindingly fast provided you have Eldrazi spawn token ramp, and can start wrecking face as early as turn three. However, it's dead weight if you don't have any spawn tokens, because hardcasting it for 9 is far less efficient than its brother Ulamog's Crusher. Still, the alternate casting cost and the hefty body that still satisfies Not of This World's alternate casting cost makes this a great card for an Eldrazi deck.

Posted By: getz19 (4/16/2010 12:43:26 AM)

posts.post_content:
Make sure to throw a [Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling) or 3 in decks containing him. Just in case your opponent has ways of taking it out.  
  
EDIT: Also, those of you saying you can get it out turn 2 at earliest are wrong. It's possible to get it out turn 1, but you need an exactly perfect hand. I want to play around a bit more with the idea and make a legacy deck around it.  
  
And Musume, the reason they're not showing up in your search is that they're tokens. Gatherer does not have info on most tokens. Eldrazi Spawn is a creature type. It even shows up on the type line of the tokens.
posts.html:
Make sure to throw a Fling or 3 in decks containing him. Just in case your opponent has ways of taking it out.

EDIT: Also, those of you saying you can get it out turn 2 at earliest are wrong. It's possible to get it out turn 1, but you need an exactly perfect hand. I want to play around a bit more with the idea and make a legacy deck around it.

And Musume, the reason they're not showing up in your search is that they're tokens. Gatherer does not have info on most tokens. Eldrazi Spawn is a creature type. It even shows up on the type line of the tokens.

posts.post_content:
From the rules:  
204.3k Creatures and tribals share their lists of subtypes; these subtypes are called creature types. The creature types are Advisor,...Elder, **Eldrazi**, Elemental,...Soltari, **Spawn**, Specter...  
Both are separate official types.
posts.html:

Both are separate official types.
